intro: Pseudoeurystyles gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's false holly, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its botanical features include lance-shaped leaves and white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often used in ornamental horticulture for its attractive appearance and adaptability to woodland gardens.
